Notes: Primary BVR platform with AWG-9 radar (200+ km detection) and 6 Fakour-90 missiles (190 km semi-active, Mach 5 for AWACS/high-value intercepts); 2 upgraded to AM std. with indigenous avionics; recent losses (5 in June 2025 strikes) reduced from 35; 81st Tactical Fighter Squadron at Bushehr, enables 190 km envelopes via Simorgh cueing despite sanctions.

Upgraded with Zhuk-ME radar (160 km) and 6 R-77/PL-12 missiles (110 km active, datalink mid-course); 24 overhauled in Russia (2010s) with Nasr-1 anti-ship; 23rd Tactical Fighter Squadron at Dezful, sustains agile BVR with Ghadir OTH integration for 150 km effective range.

Upgraded with Chinese radar (150 km) and 4-6 PL-5E/PL-11 missiles (80-100 km active/IR); Qader anti-ship tested (2013); 1 lost in January 2025; 62 across 3 squadrons (e.g., 9th at Bandar Abbas), provides volume SEAD/BVR support via limited datalinks.

Ex-Iraqi with Cyrano IV radar (100 km) and 4 Exocet/MICA upgrades (80 km semi-active); 1 lost in 2001; 23rd Tactical Fighter Squadron at Mashhad, enables maritime BVR to 120 km with Simorgh updates despite aging airframe.

Upgraded HESA variants with AN/APG-66 radar (120 km) and 4 PL-5E missiles (18 km IR, limited BVR); 44 F-5E +16 F-5F trainers; 35th Tactical Fighter Squadron at Kerman, cost-effective filler for close-in BVR-lite, integrated with ground radars for 100 km envelopes.

Ex-Iraqi/Russian with Kopyo radar (150 km) and 4 R-27 missiles (80 km semi-active); overhauled for smart munitions (2011); 3 crashes since 1991; 77th Tactical Fighter Squadron at Hamadan, supports lofted BVR strikes to 140 km via OTH cueing.

Indigenous AEW on Il-76MD with Phazotron Zhuk-AE radar (400 km horizon) for off-board targeting and mid-course Fakour/R-77 updates; critical kill-chain enabler despite sanctions; 121st Airbase at Mashhad, extends BVR to 190 km with Ghadir OTH integration.

Converted tankers with buddy refueling for 2+ hour BVR extensions on F-14/MiG-29; 13 operational (e.g., 31st Airlift Squadron at Mashhad), sustains long-range patrols in Persian Gulf via limited probe systems.
